questions.question: As there was no ............................ in waiting, we left.
The storm played havoc .............................. our flight schedules.
questions.description: The correct expression is 'play havoc with'.

questions.question: ........................ all I know, she is still married to him.
I look forward .............................. you.
questions.description: After 'look forward', we use 'to + ing form'.

questions.question: ......................... the time we reached there, they had finished.
questions.description: The correct expression is 'by the time'.

questions.question: You will have to take the stairs because the lift is ...........................
questions.description: When things are out of door, they don't work.

questions.question: You ............................ better pay the fee today to avoid late payment charges.
questions.description: The correct expression is 'had better'. It is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: His electricity was ........................... off because he hadn't paid the bill.
questions.description: To cut off is to stop the supply of something.

questions.question: She ............................. tears when I told her that she had failed her exam.
questions.description: To burst into tears is to start crying.

questions.question: The plane departed on time .............................. the fog.
questions.description: In spite of is the correct expression. Despite and in spite of mean the same and are both possible here. Even though is a conjunction and should be followed by a clause.

questions.question: The chimneys ........................ too much smoke.
questions.description: To give off is to send out.
